review_title: Fun but Management is out of Touch
years_at_company: Fun but Management is out of Touch
pros:
Discount
Fun environment
Good pay during busy season
cons:
-Management
-Pay decreases if you want to move up from shift lead.
- company culture not always followed
advice_to_mgmt:
Don’t throw your associates under the bus. Listen to your shift leads.
Be there for people who are struggling outside of work.
When someone doesn’t show up for a shift or a few shifts in a row. Maybe call and make sure they are still alive.
Don’t say everyone’s a family and not follow through.
Don’t jump to conclusions.
Don’t think you know everything. Odds are there are people working for you with more experience. You could learn something.
Better resources for employees dealing with mental health/personal issues. They should feel safe enough to open up about it.

review_title: Former Associate at the Virginia Beach Venue
years_at_company: Former Associate at the Virginia Beach Venue
pros:
You can’t find better people to work along side and I say that with as much emphasis as I can
Good money
Sometimes the family meal is fantastic
cons:
Two of the top three managers are an absolute joke
Impossible to take your 30 minute mandated break most days
Even though they say you are family, they rarely show it
advice_to_mgmt: If you are going to say that Topgolf is a family space for your associates, treat them like we are actually family. Don’t just say it to make us feel good temporarily. Actually truly care about us over your numbers. Obviously Topgolf is a for-profit business, but when you can use that almost billion dollar company revenue to treat your associates to something extraordinary. Something that would make associates actually sincerely love everything about Topgolf would be to do outings with the general population of associates, not just the shift leads, managers, platinum hosts, and the like. Make us not hate who we work for before CaddyShack makes you start to sweat.

pros: Schedule flexibility, managers respond quick, free game play, half-off food and drinks
cons: Not enough caddies will be scheduled on a popular night, those who are no call/no show are not properly replaced by someone else, little to no hours (full-time, but getting 7/8 hours in one week), below minimum wage pay, always running out of straws and kids cups/coffee cups/associate cups
advice_to_mgmt: Managers need more experience with associates, constantly butting heads. Associates are being denied the opportunity to move up/cross train to other positions. Our concerns need to be addressed throughout the venue

pros: Excellent work environment! Everyone has personality.

pros:
- Great Coworkers
- Fast paced work environment
cons:
- Favoritism is very rampant within management
- Either over or under staffed, which means either you may not be able to get hours or you will be worked hard
- Some guests can be very rude or outright aggressive
- Management is often out of touch with its employees and the venue
- "Family Meal" (employee meal) is VERY hit or miss
- Hours can be rough and inconsistent (I once worked from 3:45 PM - 2:15 AM on a Friday night with only one 15 minute break and a small plate of rice to go on)
- Employee turnover is VERY high in ALL departments
- Management is often hypocritical / plays favorites when enforcing rules
- Lack of cooperation across departments
advice_to_mgmt: I think that creating a more positive work environment would help a lot of the problems. Additionally, I think that creating stronger bonds with people across departments and with management may reduce the favoritism that is rampant and help reduce the high employee turnover.

pros: Super fun environment to work in and the people are great

advice_to_mgmt:
- be mindful of who you have in prominent positions
- do not ignore racism
- ensure other managers have an understanding of the jobs they are managing before putting them in charge

pros: Great atmosphere, team building anc culture

pros: Really fun environment. It's always like one big party . Alot of your fellow associates end up becoming your best friends or like family .you can move up really easily and fast at this job which is a major plus .not like most restaurant jobs so that can be a plus or a minus .I really enjoyed working here and the whole concept was different but cool at the same time .it is always packed so it can be hectic at times if your not used to it . Easy for first timers in the hospitality industry.
cons: Alot of favoritism at this job. Because this job is all fun and games literally all the time it breeds nothing but favoritism. Alot of the managers would never scold or warn their favorites who would constantly no call no show or be late .but would do this to the hardest working employees. When ever there is a problem good luck finding a manager for help. It would always take over 25 minutes to get a manager and there is multiple on each floor but they would be too busy goofing off. Managers always clueless on food issues or low stock of something. Really long hours in extreme weather conditions . Pay isnt really consistent either end up paying out alot of people like food runner, drink runner busser, barback,so it does take its toll from time to time .
advice_to_mgmt: Work as a team .this helps everyone so much in the long run. Stop goofing off in the hub actually do what your getting paid for . Engage with the guest be on the floor to help other fellow associates . Respect your hard working bayhost more . Stop picking who you let slide and get away with things just because they are your favorite. Be on the floor more and work together as a team please .

Topgolf was the best job I had but now I can’t even go back to it :-/ when going through the rehire process I experienced more poor communication on several occasions. Wish I could go back!

pros: Cool environment. Fun place to work
cons:
Management. Worst management team I have seen. Lawsuits, HR investigations, etc.

Plays favorites, crosses the line between professional and personal to much. Works her employees way to hard. Starts drama weekly by starting rumors, When she needed to correct me, she made other people do it. Changing seating and changing policies all the time. One week you can do this. The next week you can do that. If one of her friends wants to work from home, then she lets everyone work from home to accomodate her friend. Mood changes daily. Been investigated multiple times by HR, shes lucky people are more afraid of her than HR, otherwise we would have been honest when questioned by HR. I feel bad for everyone else who is left. Glad I got out when I did.
advice_to_mgmt: Numbers are not the only important thing in the sales department. You need new leadership, or more people will keep quitting. Find a way to cut out the drama in the sales department.

pros: I get to satisfy excited people!
cons: Taking a Rush/ Large Party’s
